intro: Daviesia oxyclada, commonly known as the narrow-leaf daviesia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and clusters of small, pinkish-red flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in heathlands and woodlands. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a distinctive hairy texture, and it is known for its ability to thrive in dry conditions. Daviesia oxyclada is an important component of the local flora and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
